dependencies.description:
This library brings the updated configparser from Python 3.5 to Python
2.6-3.5.
dependencies.name: py-configparser

dependencies.description:
Flake8 is a wrapper around PyFlakes, pep8 and Ned Batchelder's McCabe
script.
dependencies.name: py-flake8

dependencies.description:
This project is based upon the Fortran parser originally developed by
Pearu Peterson for the F2PY project, www.f2py.com. It provides a parser
for Fortran source code (up to and including F2008) implemented purely
in Python with minimal dependencies.
dependencies.name: py-fparser

dependencies.description:
Jinja2 is a template engine written in pure Python. It provides a Django
inspired non-XML syntax but supports inline expressions and an optional
sandboxed environment.
dependencies.name: py-jinja2

dependencies.description: Jsonschema: An(other) implementation of JSON Schema for Python.
dependencies.name: py-jsonschema

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.
dependencies.name: py-pytest

dependencies.description: py.test xdist plugin for distributed testing and loop-on-failing mode
dependencies.name: py-pytest-xdist

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: SymPy is a Python library for symbolic mathematics.
dependencies.name: py-sympy

dependencies.description: ANSII Color formatting for output in terminal.
dependencies.name: py-termcolor

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

description:
A source-to-source Fortran compiler designed to programmatically
optimise, parallelise and instrument HPC applications (written in
Fortran) via user- provided transformation scripts. Additionally,
PSyclone supports the development of kernel-based, Fortran-embedded DSLs
and is used in the UK Met Office's next-generation modelling system,
LFRic.
name: py-psyclone

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
